intro: Tetratheca gracilis, commonly known as the slender tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tetratheca gracilis is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
